thread.title: Newswire: Verizon and T-Mobile are having a BDSM-themed Twitter fight
thread.title_full: Newswire: Verizon and T-Mobile are having a BDSM-themed Twitter fight

author: Sam Barsanti
title: Newswire: Verizon and T-Mobile are having a BDSM-themed Twitter fight
text:
Share Tweet 
During the Super Bowl, Kristen Schaal appeared in a couple of T-Mobile ads that compared having Verizon as your wireless provider to being in some kind of Fifty Shades Of Grey -esque BDSM relationship: 
It was the typical sort of cellphone company sniping you see on every other day of the year, but ramped up a bit for the sake of the Super Bowl. Rather than immediately getting to work on a counter-ad that picks apart T-Mobile‚Äôs claims, though, whoever runs Verizon‚Äôs social media pages jumped on Twitter and went to war: Yes @Tmobile , we‚Äôre into BDSM. Bigger coverage map, Devastating Speed, and Massive capacity. 
T-Mobile CEO John Legere joined in, because that‚Äôs the sort of thing you do when your company‚Äôs entire advertising platform is built on talking about how you‚Äôre cool and your competitors are lame: . @verizon guys... it can‚Äôt go any further. calm down. pic.twitter.com/jINXguIUAD ‚Äî John Legere (@JohnLegere) February 6, 2017 
Verizon hit again, this time with a creative use of the ‚Äúmouth zipped shut‚Äù emoji: Unfortunately no one will hear your safe word if you‚Äôre on @Tmobile . ü§ê
